001package gust.backend.driver.firestore;
002
003import com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListeningScheduledExecutorService;
004import com.google.protobuf.Message;
005import gust.backend.model.*;
006import gust.backend.runtime.Logging;
007import io.micronaut.context.annotation.Context;
008import io.micronaut.context.annotation.Factory;
009import io.micronaut.runtime.context.scope.Refreshable;
010import org.slf4j.Logger;
011
012import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
013import javax.annotation.concurrent.Immutable;
014import javax.annotation.concurrent.ThreadSafe;
015import java.util.Optional;
016
017
018/**
019 * Defines a built-in database adapter for interacting with Google Cloud Firestore, using business-data models defined
020 * through Protobuf annotated with framework-provided metadata.
021 *
022 * <p>This adapter makes use of a specialized {@link DatabaseDriver} ({@link FirestoreDriver}), and supports a custom
023 * configuration class ({@link FirestoreTransportConfig}) which is loaded from application config during service channel
024 * initialization. Connections are pooled and cached against a caching executor by the active transport manager.</p>
025 *
026 * <p>Instantiation is disallowed to facilitate restriction of the active {@link ModelCodec} to Firestore's own model
027 * codec, which uses {@link gust.backend.model.ObjectModelCodec} to produce generic collapsed messages during
028 * serialization, and to translate from proto-maps during deserialization. Optionally, a compliant instance of
029 * {@link CacheDriver} may be provided at construction time, which enables caching against that driver for calls that
030 * are eligible (according, again, to settings from {@link FirestoreTransportConfig}).</p>
031 *
032 * @param <Model> Model type which this adapter adapts to Firestore.
033 * @see FirestoreDriver Driver for speaking to Firestore.
034 * @see FirestoreTransportConfig Transport configuration for Firestore.
035 */
036@Immutable
037@ThreadSafe
038@SuppressWarnings({"WeakerAccess", "unused", "UnstableApiUsage"})
039public final class FirestoreAdapter<Key extends Message, Model extends Message>
040  implements DatabaseAdapter<Key, Model, CollapsedMessage> {
041  /** Private log pipe. */
042  private static final Logger logging = Logging.logger(FirestoreAdapter.class);
043
044  /** Firestore database driver. */
045  private final @Nonnull FirestoreDriver<Key, Model> driver;
046
047  /** Serializer and deserializer for this model. */
048  private final @Nonnull ModelCodec<Model, CollapsedMessage> codec;
049
050  /** Cache to use for model interactions through this adapter (optional). */
051  private final @Nonnull Optional<CacheDriver<Key, Model>> cache;
052
053  /**
054   * Setup a new Firestore adapter from scratch. Generally instances of this class are acquired through injection, or
055   * static factory methods also listed on this class.
056   *
057   * @param driver Database driver to use when speaking to Firestore.
058   * @param codec Serializer and deserializer to use.
059   * @param cache Cache to use when reading data from Firestore (optional).
060   */
061  private FirestoreAdapter(@Nonnull FirestoreDriver<Key, Model> driver,
062                           @Nonnull ModelCodec<Model, CollapsedMessage> codec,
063                           @Nonnull Optional<CacheDriver<Key, Model>> cache) {
064    this.driver = driver;
065    this.codec = codec;
066    this.cache = cache;
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Create or otherwise resolve a {@link FirestoreAdapter} for the provided model type and builder. This additionally
071   * resolves a model codec, driver, and optionally a caching engine as well (although one may be provided explicitly at
072   * the invoking developer's discretion - see {@link #forModel(Message.Builder, FirestoreDriver, Optional)}).
073   *
074   * <p>The resulting adapter may not be created fresh for the task at hand, but it is threadsafe and shares no direct
075   * state with any other operation.</p>
076   *
077   * @see #forModel(Message.Builder, FirestoreDriver, Optional) To provide an explicit cache driver for this type.
078   * @param <M> Model type for which we are requesting a Firestore adapter instance.
079   * @param builder Model builder instance, which the engine will clone for each retrieve operation.
080   * @param driver Driver which we should use when handling instances of <code>M</code>.
081   * @return Pre-fabricated (or otherwise resolved) Firestore adapter for the requested model.
082   */
083  public static @Nonnull <K extends Message, M extends Message> FirestoreAdapter<K, M> forModel(
084    @Nonnull Message.Builder builder,
085    @Nonnull FirestoreDriver<K, M> driver) {
086    return forModel(builder, driver, Optional.empty());
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Create or otherwise resolve a {@link FirestoreAdapter} for the provided model type and builder. This additionally
091   * resolves a model codec, driver, and optionally a caching engine as well.
092   *
093   * <p>The resulting adapter may not be created fresh for the task at hand, but it is threadsafe and shares no direct
094   * state with any other operation.</p>
095   *
096   * @param <M> Model type for which we are requesting a Firestore adapter instance.
097   * @param driver Driver which we should use when handling instances of <code>M</code>.
098   * @param builder Model builder instance, which the engine will clone for each retrieve operation.
099   * @return Pre-fabricated (or otherwise resolved) Firestore adapter for the requested model.
100   */
101  public static @Nonnull <K extends Message, M extends Message> FirestoreAdapter<K, M> forModel(
102    @Nonnull Message.Builder builder,
103    @Nonnull FirestoreDriver<K, M> driver,
104    @Nonnull Optional<CacheDriver<K, M>> cacheDriver) {
105    return new FirestoreAdapter<>(
106      driver,
107      CollapsedMessageCodec.forModel(builder),
108      cacheDriver);
109  }
110
111  /** Factory responsible for creating {@link FirestoreAdapter} instances from injected dependencies. */
112  @Factory
113  final static class FirestoreAdapterFactory {
114    /**
115     * Acquire a new instance of the Firestore adapter, using the specified component objects to facilitate model
116     * serialization/deserialization, and transport communication with Firestore.
117     *
118     * @param messageInstance Empty message instance to infer type information from.
119     * @param driver Driver with which we should talk to Firestore.
120     * @param cache Driver with which we should cache eligible data.
121     * @return Firestore driver instance.
122     */
123    @Context
124    @Refreshable
125    public static @Nonnull <K extends Message, M extends Message> FirestoreAdapter<K, M> acquire(
126      @Nonnull Message messageInstance,
127      @Nonnull FirestoreDriver<K, M> driver,
128      @Nonnull Optional<CacheDriver<K, M>> cache) {
129      // resolve model builder from type
130      return FirestoreAdapter.forModel(
131        messageInstance.newBuilderForType(),
132        driver,
133        cache);
134    }
135  }
136
137  // -- Components -- //
138  /** {@inheritDoc} */
139  @Override
140  public @Nonnull ModelCodec<Model, CollapsedMessage> codec() {
141    return this.codec;
142  }
143
144  /** {@inheritDoc} */
145  @Override
146  public @Nonnull Optional<CacheDriver<Key, Model>> cache() {
147    return this.cache;
148  }
149
150  /** {@inheritDoc} */
151  @Override
152  public @Nonnull DatabaseDriver<Key, Model, CollapsedMessage> engine() {
153    return this.driver;
154  }
155
156  /** {@inheritDoc} */
157  @Override
158  public @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService() {
159    return driver.executorService();
160  }
161}
